intro: Erigeron membranaceus, commonly known as the membranous fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Erigeron membranaceus is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
